A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Very disappointing.
I'm not a Star Wars fanboy\, just a 50-something dad who has enjoyed the past films and loved going with my family to watch. But if you make a film in such a wonderful Franchise\, I feel you should respect its conventions far more than this did: Luke's character\, Force powers and so on. (Personally I found the disdain and snark from Vice Admiral Purple Hair really grated - as if prior Star Wars plots relied on carefully thought through plans and real-world tactical prudence. The way Poe was set up and knocked down felt really forced and graceless to me). Even as a generic sci-fi film it didn't work for me - I'd reference\, among other things\, the flabby casino excursion\, underwhelming appearance and departure of Snork\, pathetic 'chase the cruisers' set-up\, and the fact that Finn's whole special mission was pointless.
I'm not a hater\, but I find myself very sympathetic to the outraged fans here. Sufficiently\, in fact\, to motivate me to write this\, my first review on Rotten Tomatoes.
It's not wholly bad\, of course. I found Kylo Ren\, Rey and Finn all interesting characters I could invest in\, and loved the actors.
But we left the cinema quiet and disappointed\, and I saw similar expressions around me from most of the audience over the age of 10.
You know\, as a businessman it's also the commercial incompetence that grips me. To screw up such a great Franchise and leave your customers feeling disappointed and underwhelmed - come on. This will be the first S=tar Wars movie where I don't buy DVDs etc\, and we almost certainly won't go to see the next one. Very sad.
Overall: a let down and a missed opportunity due to a lack of conviction\, a lack of discipline and a lack of sympathy for the universe\, combined with some weak-assed writing and direction. Shame. Time to move on from Star Wars
